description: Let's you visualise cluster health, latency, indexing rate, free storage and more.

panels.description: Indicates shard allocation status.
panels.title: Cluster Status

panels.description: Indicates where data nodes can reach the master node. Failures are usually the result of a network connectivity problem.
panels.title: Master instance connection status

panels.description: Failure indicate that no automated snapshot has succeeded in the past 36 hours.
panels.title: Snapshot failure status

panels.description: The total number of nodes for your cluster. This metric can increase (often doubling) during configuration changes and service software updates.
panels.title: Total nodes

panels.description: Indicates whether the cluster is accepting or blocking write requests. If your cluster is blocking write requests, check storage space, JVM memory pressure and CPU utilization.
panels.title: Cluster Writes Status

panels.description: The total amount of free storage space, accross all data nodes.
panels.title: Total free storage space

panels.description: The total number of searchable documents across all indices in the cluster.
panels.title: Searchable documents

panels.description: The total number of documents marked for deletion across all indices in the cluster.
panels.title: Deleted Documents

panels.description: The number of indexing operations per minute. For example, a single call to the _bulk API that adds two documents and updates two counts as four operations plus four additional operations per replica. Document deletions do not towards this metric.
panels.title: Indexing Rate

panels.description: The number of search operations per minute for all shards in the cluster. For example, a single call to the _search API that returns results from five shards counts as five operations.
panels.title: SearchRate

panels.description: The average time that it takes a shard to complete a search  operation.
panels.title: Search Latency

panels.description: The average time that it takes a shard to complete an indexing operation.
panels.title: Indexing Latency

panels.description: The number of requests to a domain, aggregated by HTTP response code (2xx, 3xx, 4xx, 5xx).
panels.title: HTTP Requests by Response code

panels.description: The total number of HTTP requests and the number of requests that included and invalid (or missing) host header. Valid requests include the domain endpoint as the host header.
panels.title: Invalid Host Header Requests

panels.description: Metrics for the write thread pool: number of threads, tasks in the queue and rejected tasks. If the queue size is consistently high or rejected count is high, consider scaling your cluster.
panels.title: Write Thread Pool

panels.description: Metrics for the index thread pool: number of threads tasks in the queue and rejected tasks. If the queue size is consistently high or rejected count is high, consider scaling your cluster.
panels.title: Index Thread Pool

panels.description: Metrics for search thread pool: number of threads tasks in the queue and rejected tasks. If the queue size is consistently high or rejected count is high, consider scaling your cluster.
panels.title: Search Thread Pool

panels.description: Metrics for the force merge thread pool: number of threads tasks in the queue and rejected tasks. If the queue size is consistently high or rejected count is high, consider scaling your cluster.
panels.title: Merge Thread Pool

panels.description: Maximum CPU utilization percentage for all data nodes.
panels.title: Maximum CPU Utilization

panels.description: Maximum JVM memory pressure percentage for all data nodes.
panels.title: Maximum JVMMemoryPressure

panels.description: The amount of free storage space on the data node with the smallest amount of free storage space in the cluster.
panels.title: Minimum free storage space

panels.description: Maximum memory usage percentage for all data nodes.
panels.title: Maximum Memory Utilization

panels.description: Maximum CPU utilization percentage for all data nodes.
panels.title: Maximum CPU Utilization

panels.description: Maximum JVM memory pressure percentage for all data nodes.
panels.title: Maximum JVMMemoryPressure

panels.description: The amount of free storage space on the data node with the smallest amount of free storage space in the cluster.
panels.title: Minimum free storage space

panels.description: Maximum memory usage percentage for all data nodes.
panels.title: Maximum Memory Utilization

panels.description: CPU utilization percentage for the master node.
panels.title: Maximum CPU Utilization

panels.description: JVM memory pressure percentage for the master node.
panels.title: Maximum JVMMemoryPressure

panels.description: The amount of free storage space on the data node with the smallest amount of free storage space in the cluster.
panels.title: Minimum free storage space

panels.description: Maximum memory usage percentage for all data nodes.
panels.title: Maximum Memory Utilization

panels.description: The amount of time, in milliseconds that the cluster has spent performing "Young generation" garbage collection.
panels.title: Young Collection Time

panels.description: The number of times that "Young generation" garbage collection has run. A large number if runs is a normal part of cluster operations.
panels.title: Young collection

title: AWS OpenSearch
